extendedIngredients.name: beets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 beets, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch wedges (1 1/2 pounds)
extendedIngredients.originalName: beets, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch wedges (1 1/2 pounds)

extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large fennel bulb with fronds—bulb cut into 1/2-inch wedges, 1 tablespoon chopped fronds
extendedIngredients.originalName: fennel bulb with fronds—bulb cut into 1/2-inch wedges, 1 tablespoon chopped fronds
meta: with fronds—bulb cut into 1/2-inch wedges, 1 tablespoon chopped fronds

title: Roasted Beet and Fennel Salad
summary: Roasted Beet and Fennel Salad is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish. This recipe serves 4 and costs 79 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 2g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 116 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have beets, fennel bulb, water, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour. With a spoonacular score of 50%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Roasted Beet, Fennel, and Walnut Salad, Oven-roasted Rump Of Lamb With Baby Artichokes, Beet And Fennel, and Roasted Beet and Shallot Salad over Wilted Beet Greens and Arugula.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400. In a medium baking dish, toss the beets with the thyme, the water and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and cook for about 40 minutes, or until tender. Let cool slightly. Discard the thyme.                                              In a small baking dish, drizzle the fennel wedges with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer, or until tender and lightly browned.                                              Pour the beet juices into a bowl and whisk in the vinegar. Add the beets, fennel wedges and fronds and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

steps.step: In a medium baking dish, toss the beets with the thyme, the water and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and cook for about 40 minutes, or until tender.
Let cool slightly. Discard the thyme.

In a small baking dish, drizzle the fennel wedges with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer, or until tender and lightly browned.
Pour the beet juices into a bowl and whisk in the vinegar.
Add the beets, fennel wedges and fronds and season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
